messages.message: Have we done anything around extracting org charts? C1 has a use case where they want to extract an org chart, including which boxes are connected to what. Not sure this is possible even in UDF land, but thought I’d mention it here in case someone has a an idea of how to do it before I tell them no.
@paul we have had pretty poor results parsing org charts in the past with Abbyy
But def worth it to see if Emerson delivers better otuput for those kinds of documents
There's a whole separate story around the line detection
outside of the text extraction, what about lines / spatial stuff?
Abbyy reports a list of lines in the document, but we haven't really gone through to look at what that would be in this case
That's probably only a ~hour exercise though
(just read in the raw line output and draw it right back on the page image in bright green or something... to get a quick eyeball of which ones it got and which ones it didn't get)
i’ll get some more in-depth requirements tomorrow, but ultimately they want to extract the graph from the org chart
just like, here’s the boxes we found, here’s what was connected to what
Yeah this seems like it's been a long running desire of theirs. I remember them asking about it a year ago
yep, same group; something they’d really like to crack
It might be worthwhile when you chat w/ them to ask about this too:
Whether the fractional parent/child relationships are important
for now, no — the thing they really care about is which orgs are connected
